entry.title: JSON Error
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 121.0.6167.185 OS : Windows 10 Pro
What steps will reproduce the problem? Logging into ADP -> Choosing Service Requests (Section in website allowed to see inquires to ADP representatives)
What is the expected result? Expected to open page of open requests that can be clicked on and additional comments may be added to communicate back and forth with representatives.
What happens instead? Red boxed error shows with bottom just loading continiously (even after deleting cahe and data). Box contains: Unexpected token '<', "<!doctype "...is not valid JSON Attempted to try other browers and devices and same issues. On firefox it states: JSON.parse: unexpected character at line 1 column 1 of the JSON data
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Clean up special testing logic for kForceThirdPartyCookieBlocking (if necessary)
entry.content:
Follow-up cleanup tasks for https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5310537.
Audit checks of kForceThirdPartyCookieBlocking. Where do we need special logic for force-testing, and where should we instead be checking for 3PCD / tracking-protection onboarding to include the prod behavior?
Feel free to close if this is unnecessary.

entry.title: Sometimes vTPMs fails to create ECDSA P-256 key
entry.content:
Before creating an unexportable key, it is checked if the required alg is supported. Sometimes even if it is claimed that the algo is supported it will fail with TPM_E_PCP_INTERNAL_ERROR during https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:crypto/unexportable_key_win.cc;l=112;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090;bpv=0;bpt=1.
It looks like this is always on specific virtual hardware.
As this affects under .1% of devices right now we just ignore it. I can see a few options of how to better handle this, and we need to do something as it happens on new trybots.
1. Handle fail key gracefully, for now that mostly means expect it can happen in tests. 2. Have a blocklist of known bad TPMs and disable ECDSA keys for these. RSA keys will work. 3. Create a config file, and if this fails once on this device disable ECDSA keys for this device in the future. 4. Always use RSA keys for everyone.

entry.title: this keeps popping up on my screen
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?

What happens instead?

entry.title: [Blink CSS]: 1 regressions in blink_perf.css
entry.content:
All graphs for this regression group at 1262628:1262634:
Internal (Googlers-only) Reports: - Chromium: https://chrome-perf.corp.goog/_/alertgroup?group_id=a2703127-85fe-4f42-b294-54bc31e9049b
(Legacy) Chromeperf Report: https://chromeperf.appspot.com/group_report?group_id=a2703127-85fe-4f42-b294-54bc31e9049b
Top 1 regressions (out of 1, with 0 improvements) in this group: - ChromiumPerf/android-pixel4_webview-perf/blink_perf.css/CustomPropertiesPendingSubstitution/CustomPropertiesPendingSubstitution.html 27.87%: 47.260000000000005 -> 60.43 ms
Top 1 affected measurements in android-pixel4_webview-perf: - blink_perf.css/CustomPropertiesPendingSubstitution/CustomPropertiesPendingSubstitution.html 27.87%: 47.260000000000005 -> 60.43 ms
Regressions grouped by blink_perf.css includes data from the following benchmarks with listed owners: blink_perf.css: andruud@chromium.org, futhark@chromium.org
Commits in this range: Chromium Git Hash: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/6b930760f45ba8157554bf77ae4bb14576880d80..abff502309aee37a082a9e7639a5d0e3eeb87368 Chromium Commit Position: https://crrev.com/1262627..1262634 V8 Commit Position: https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+log/a86e1971579f4165123467fa6ad378e552536b43..a86e1971579f4165123467fa6ad378e552536b43 WebRTC Git Hash: https://webrtc.googlesource.com/src/+log/5437df35c6fcf937617ee02fec8530b6e82a1067..8c38eed63c29782d65b4cc22d64daea121a44909

entry.title: Re-enable ACG for true jitless processes
entry.content: As part of the mitigation for https://issues.chromium.org/issues/325974501, I'm going to change the meaning of RenderProcessHostImpl::IsJitDisabled() to be "are v8 optimizations disabled?", which means that a) all the involved function/method names are now at best misleading, and b) ACG is disabled for processes for which it used to be enabled (namely renderers that are subject to this policy).

entry.title: updater: remove unnecessary InterlockedExchange call
entry.content: It's not clear that the call is needed at all.

entry.title: Flag expired : webui-tab-strip-context-menu-after-tap is expired in M116
entry.content:
In accordance with //docs/flag_expiry.md, the flag "webui-tab-strip-context-menu-after-tap" has expired and been removed from the chrome://flags UI. This bug tracks cleaning up the code that implements this flag. Please help us clean up the codebase :) If you need help or more context please get in touch with flags-dev@chromium.org.
This bug should be used for removing the flag entry in the flag-metadata.json as well as the code related to the flag.
This bug is generated based on the list of expired flags in flag-metadata.json file as per refs/heads/main@{#1262818}
This flag has been marked as expiring in M116 or earlier. This bug has been opened for the Eng teams to clean up the references for the flag in the //chrome/browser/flag-metadata.json as well as references to that flag.
This is a friendly reminder to help get this clean up completed.
If you think this flag needs to be extended beyond this milestone, please follow these steps: - If you see a flag listed as expiring that you want to keep, create a CL updating //chrome/browser/flag-metadata.json with an appropriate new expiration milestone. - If you do this before the M116 branch you're all set; if you do it after the M116 branch you'll need to merge that CL to the M116 branch as well.
You can check the branch date for this milestone at https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/schedule

entry.title: Create and record metrics on the length of time VisitedLinkNavigationThrottle spends in DEFER
entry.content: The goal of this metric is to determine on average how much time a given navigation would spend in a DEFER state if the VisitedLinkNavigationThrottle were allowed to land.

entry.title: "Search tabs" menu keeps changing order of tabs in list even when I'm not typing anything
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open tab search (command-shift-A on the Mac) 2. Type a search term that is common to several tabs (in my case it was "drx") 3. Wait a few seconds
# Problem Description The list of tabs keeps changing and re-ordering itself every second or two, even if you don't type anything else. This makes it very difficult to actually select one, as the one you want keeps moving around. I don't recall this being a problem before.
# Summary "Search tabs" menu keeps changing order of tabs in list even when I'm not typing anything
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Temporarily revert changes that make existing QUIC functionality more broken, for M123
entry.content:
For M123, we haven't quite closed off all of the avenues by which a QUIC proxy might be used (https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5253717). That support is known to be quite limited (`http://` URLs only) and at least a little bit buggy. But we're not sure it's totally unused.
Several CLs have since landed with the assumption that we would be removing this support: * https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5254679 (Remove enable_quic_proxies_for_https_urls) * https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5231469 (Refactor IsValidInternal to allow multi-proxy chain of quic servers for IP Protection) * specifically `IsValidInternal` in `net/base/proxy_chain.cc` now prohibits single-hop QUIC proxies * https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241818 (Tunnel HTTP requests over QUIC proxies)

entry.title: Skip sync feature check if the bookmarks are account-bound
entry.content: Workaround to get salient images working post-butter.

entry.title: Tests are failing: ninja://ios/chrome/test/earl_grey2:ios_chrome_integration_eg2tests_module/NTPHomeTestCase/testFavicons
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures with the test name: ninja://ios/chrome/test/earl_grey2:ios_chrome_integration_eg2tests_module/NTPHomeTestCase/testFavicons
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/f23d79b2d5e7ad257dab7dbbdb8851d4

entry.title: [Blink Bindings Perf Regressions]: 1 regressions in blink_perf.bindings
entry.content:
All graphs for this regression group at 1262520:1262535:
Internal (Googlers-only) Reports: - Chromium: https://chrome-perf.corp.goog/_/alertgroup?group_id=e2772942-5d90-4813-895e-add29325312c
(Legacy) Chromeperf Report: https://chromeperf.appspot.com/group_report?group_id=e2772942-5d90-4813-895e-add29325312c
Top 1 regressions (out of 1, with 0 improvements) in this group: - ChromiumPerf/android-pixel2_webview-perf/blink_perf.bindings/indexed-getter/indexed-getter.html 1.24%: 8572.953 -> 8466.409
Top 1 affected measurements in android-pixel2_webview-perf: - blink_perf.bindings/indexed-getter/indexed-getter.html 1.24%: 8572.953 -> 8466.409
Regressions grouped by blink_perf.bindings includes data from the following benchmarks with listed owners: blink_perf.bindings: None
Commits in this range:
